entry.title: Block - Back Date Invoicing
entry.content:

Thanks, and Regards

Mani Sajnani

entry.title: Activity Cost Rate validity
entry.content:
Hello,

I maintained plan cost rates for 2025. When checking the rates, they come up with validity 2024, despite they are valid from 1st Jan 2025. Was it maintained incorrect somehow? I used the app Manage Plan Cost Rates (F3162).

Best regards

Anja

entry.title: Quality management configuration assistance
entry.content:
Hi, As per the requirement, we need to create separate inspection lot origins for sample inspections, such as 5-piece, line, and PDI, for different inspection lot types. While attempting to configure this on the server, the option appears grayed out and does not allow me to add the custom inspection lots.

Could you please guide me on how to achieve this? Your support would be highly appreciated.

Best regards,
Aditya

entry.title: Creating a completely custom form in SAP Public Cloud 2508 triggered from MES for Production Complet
entry.content:
Hello Community,

I am working in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud 2508 and need to generate an output label for Production Operation Notifications that is not available in the standard templates.

The key requirement is that this label should be generated from our MES system when a production order is completed, directly in the notification.

Our goal is to create the label from scratch because there are no templates for the case we need, but we have not found clear documentation on how to do this in Public Cloud, since we usually use existing templates in the Manage Form Templates app and Adobe LiveCycle Designer.

My specific questions are:

  1. Is it possible to create a form completely from scratch in Public Cloud, without relying on predefined templates?

  2. How would the fields from the Production module (e.g., operation notifications) be connected to the form?

  3. Are there recommended alternatives to generate custom labels triggered from the MES system when a production order completes?

Additionally, if anyone has SAP documentation, notes, or guides related to this topic, I would be extremely grateful, as I have found very little information for Public Cloud.

I would greatly appreciate any guidance, examples, or SAP notes that could help address this scenario.

Thank you in advance.

SAP Forms service by Adobe SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Manufacturing

entry.title: Disable the automatic settlement of production/Process orders through event base in our SAP system
entry.content:
I would like to know if it is possible to stop or disable the automatic settlement of production orders through event base in our SAP Public cloud system. Currently, production orders are being automatically settled during the period-end closing process, but for certain business cases, we would like to either control this manually or exclude specific orders or order types from being auto-settled.

My production order type dependanted  parameter change manual settlement.After create a production order using changed production type and confirmed.

In this order have price variance but system don't calculate price variance, For refarence i have attach a screenshot.

Please provide a solution how to calculate price variance.

entry.title: PM order user status in S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hi SAP experts!

In SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, I can define status schemes in Customizing (ID 105327), but I cannot select a user status in the master record of a PM order. I also cannot find any indication in the documentation on PM scope items as to whether the user status is now available or not.

Does anyone have an answer/hint/link to this?

Thank you for any information and best regards.

Rado

entry.title: Changing materials without losing history
entry.content:
I am trying to figure out the best way to handle this situation. My company is a recycling company. Using a process order, we take widgets, disassemble them and separate them into different parts, each different part being a unique Semi Finished Good. Once they are separated, the parts are tested for their quality and then moved into a graded Finished Good material. What is the best way to handle the process for grading?

We are considering doing a material to material transfer to take the SFG to the Graded FG. But the problem with that is that we lose the batch number, the inspection results and traceability to the original widgets. We are also looking into using a rework process order, but that would be a lot more work for the quality team to manage. But in this case, we could copy the inspection results to the new inspection lot (Inspection Results are important for the Certificate of Analysis).

Does anyone have any recommendations on the best way? Is there another way I haven’t considered?

 

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Rendering of Document via service ADS failed
entry.content:
Hi,

Good day!

We have created and deployed custom form templates for documents of various LOBs such as Purchase Order, Goods Receipt, Sales Invoice, and Check Voucher and we have encountered the error " Rendering of Document via Service ADS failed" when generating the output form from the transactions.  We also noted that the output forms being subjected to the error is not the custom form but the standard ones.  Please see attached sample notifications for the whole error message.

 

 

 

We would like to know what causes this error and how to address this as per our consultants, the configurations for the form templates in the Development System and in CBC have already been done.

Thank you and God bless.

Sincerely,

 

Melvin Banggo

entry.title: CO Production Order Issue in S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hi Community Team,

WIP production will be carried out for a customer who currently does not have the PP module. Is it possible to use the CO production order in the public cloud system? If not, what alternative can we use instead?

BR

entry.title: Why Can a Contract with Blocked Status in the Source List Still Be Used as a Source?
entry.content:
Hello,

I have a question regarding the process of creating a Purchase Contract and Source List, and assigning a source to a Purchase Requisition.

As I understand, in the Source List for a material, the source can be either a Purchase Info Record or a Purchase Contract.
In my case, I created three Purchase Contracts for the same material and assigned all of them as sources in the Source List.
Then, I set one contract to Fixed, and the other two to Blocked status.

I expected that only the contract marked as Fixed would be assigned as the source in the Purchase Requisition.
However, I found that the Blocked contracts were also selectable as sources, and even Purchase Orders were created successfully based on them.

Could someone explain what functional role these status values actually play?
Or is there a setting in CBC or elsewhere that I might have missed?

Thank you in advance!

entry.title: Issue with Batch-Specific UOM Quantity Display in Warehouse Monitor vs MMBE in SAP Public Cloud.
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

While receiving material with batch-specific UOM through synchronous goods receipt in Warehouse Management in SAP Public Cloud, I observed an issue.

The base UOM for the material is TO, and the alternative UOM is EA. I am receiving the material in EA with a batch-specific UOM ratio, where each EA is considered as a handling unit. However, when I check the received quantity in the Warehouse Monitor app, the EA is displayed according to the batch-specific UOM ratio instead of reflecting the actual received quantity in EA.

On the other hand, when I check in MMBE, the receiving quantity is displayed correctly.

Could you please advise on the reason for this discrepancy and the possible resolution?

entry.title: Issue with Batch-Specific UOM Quantity Display in Warehouse Monitor vs MMBE in SAP Public Cloud.
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

While receiving material with batch-specific UOM through synchronous goods receipt in Warehouse Management in SAP Public Cloud, I observed an issue.

The base UOM for the material is TO, and the alternative UOM is EA. I am receiving the material in EA with a batch-specific UOM ratio, where each EA is considered as a handling unit. However, when I check the received quantity in the Warehouse Monitor app, the EA is displayed according to the batch-specific UOM ratio instead of reflecting the actual received quantity in EA.

On the other hand, when I check in MMBE, the receiving quantity is displayed correctly.

Could you please advise on the reason for this discrepancy and the possible resolution?

For reference i have attached some images - Please review.

entry.title: Business Partner Relationship WebService Inbound
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

i am working on an interface between Salesforce and SAP and i am using the Inbound Business Partner/Business Partner Relationship Service.

Because of the format of the SalesForce ID( e.g. 003bY00000lm0NyQAI ) it is not possible to fill the field "InternalID" in the Request for Business Partner Creation. So im am using the field "ExternalID" which works in general and the key mapping is created.

But when i try to use the external keys for the relationship:

the following error occours:

I tried it with the fields ReceiverBusinessPartnerInternalID/ReceiverRelationshipBusinessPartnerInternalID and it works. But if the contact is not created yet, i do not have the ReceiverRelationshipBusinessPartnerInternalID at that time.

To my understanding this should work with the external keys aswell, where SAP is searching for the Internal Business Partner Numbers in the Key Mapping Table.

I would appreciate any hints on this topic 🙂

Regards

Simon
